newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sakura shares up on buy-back report.
newsitem.headline: Sakura shares up on buy-back report.

text.p: Shares in Sakura Bank Ltd climbed on Tuesday morning, helped by a newspaper report saying that the commercial bank plans to buy back up to 350 million of its own shares, traders said.
At 0043 GMT, Sakura was up 10 yen at 852, after briefly rising to 870. Its volume was the heaviest on the first section at 3.178 million shares.
Sakura Bank later confirmed the newspaper report.
A Sakura Bank spokesman said the share repurchase is aimed at improving the company's return-on-equity ratio.
The timing of the buy-back will be decided with consideration to the bank's business performance, he said.
